meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be assigned.
meanings.sent1: Her assignability to complete tasks efficiently impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: The assignability of roles in the group project made collaboration easier.
meanings.sent3: The assignability of the puzzle pieces to fit perfectly together brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: His assignability to adapt to new situations quickly was like a superpower.
meanings.sent5: The assignability of the keys to unlock different doors made the game more challenging.

meanings.definition: The state of being transferable to another person or entity.
meanings.sent1: The assignability of the contract allowed for a smooth transition of ownership.
meanings.sent2: Legal documents often include clauses about assignability to protect all parties involved.
meanings.sent3: The assignability of the cookie recipe to different bakers led to a delicious competition.
meanings.sent4: The assignability of responsibilities in the team resembled a game of hot potato.
meanings.sent5: The assignability of the bus tickets to different passengers caused confusion at the station.
